HTMLFontElement.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated Implements the document object model (DOM) representation of the font element. The HTML Font Element font defines the font size, font face and color of text.

remarks.para: -The HTML element implementing this interface: font.

HTMLFontElementColor.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The obsolete
HTMLFontElement.color
property is a string that reflects the color HTML attribute, containing either a named color or a color specified in the
hexadecimal #RRGGBB format.

remarks.para: The format of the string must follow one of the following HTML microsyntaxes (see <color>):

HTMLFontElementColor.value: A string.When set to the null value, that null value is converted to the empty string (""), so elt.color = null is equivalent to elt.color = "".

HTMLFontElementSize.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The obsolete
HTMLFontElement.size property is a
string that reflects the size HTML
attribute. It contains either a font size ranging from 1 to 7 or a
number relative to the default value 3, for example -2 or +1.

remarks.para: The format of the string must follow one of the following HTML microsyntaxes:

HTMLFontElementFace.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The obsolete
HTMLFontElement.face
property is a string that reflects the face HTML attribute, containing a comma-separated list of one or more font
names.

remarks.para:
The document text, in the default style, is rendered as the first font face that the
client's browser supports. If no font listed is installed on the local system, the
browser typically defaults to the proportional or fixed-width font for that system.
The format of the string must follow one of the following HTML microsyntax:

td.para: List of one or more valid font family names

para.strong: A list of font names, that have to be present on the local system
